alert.note: Alert for Baylor; Knox (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 8:08PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Knox and Baylor Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 808 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking the leading edge of winds from strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lake Kemp to near Seymour to 6 miles northeast of Millers Creek Reservoir to 6 miles north of Irby. Strong wind gusts will preceed the heavy rain and small hail by several minutes. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Seymour, Munday, Goree, Red Springs, Lake Kemp, Mabelle, Westover, Rhineland, and Bomarton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Severe weather is not expected and no warnings are anticipated at this time. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
